meanings.definition: A member of a group of people in southern Louisiana descended from French-speaking Acadians expelled from Nova Scotia in the 18th century.
meanings.sent1: The cajun at the festival played the accordion beautifully.
meanings.sent2: I tried some delicious cajun food at the restaurant last night.
meanings.sent3: Why did the cajun bring a crawfish to the dance party? To have a shell of a good time!
meanings.sent4: Her vibrant personality was like a cajun spice, adding flavor to every conversation.
meanings.sent5: The cajun's heritage was as rich and colorful as a Mardi Gras parade.

meanings.definition: Of or relating to Cajuns or their culture.
meanings.sent1: The cajun music filled the air with lively rhythms.
meanings.sent2: She wore a beautiful cajun-style dress to the celebration.
meanings.sent3: The cajun gumbo recipe was so spicy, it set off the fire alarm!
meanings.sent4: The cajun influence in the town was as unmistakable as the scent of gumbo cooking.
meanings.sent5: The vibrant colors of the cajun flag represented the diversity of the community.
